entry.title: Game: N+ (X360, 2008) (9)
entry.content: Played Episode 41 Level 4 for almost an hour. Sometimes when I play this game, I think to myself, "Wow, I hate this game's controls so much." It is so frustrating that they never seem to work right. Super Meat Boy has almost ruined every other platformer for me. In fact, I'm so mad at the game right now, I am demoting it from every two days to once a week.

entry.title: Movie: Ponyo, directed by Hayao Miyazaki (2008)
entry.content: My three year old loved this movie when he was two and it was on Netflix. I think it is very cute and does a great job with the visuals and in particular the expressiveness of the characters. I think the kids act just like little kids. I don't like the plot as much as other Miyazaki movies because almost nothing happens. It's very meh. But it is still good because of how cool the characters are.

entry.title: Game: N+ (X360, 2008) (8)
entry.content: Episode 40 Level 1 was pretty painful, but only 30 minutes painful, not an hour painful.

entry.title: Game: N+ (X360, 2008) (7)
entry.content: I've been playing Episode 39 for over an hour. The majority of that time was spent on level 1. My eyes hurt and I can't play anymore. I'm going to take a break. Currently I am at level 4. Phew!

entry.title: Game: N+ (X360, 2008) (6)
entry.content: Some of the levels in the game are just too absurd. For example, Episode 39, level 1 has you do the same challenge over and over again. The game just isn't very streamlined in the teaching you. You feel like you know how to do something but are forced to do it again, even though you aren't really dying and restarting. Obviously I'll still be it, but it's very annoying. The worst thing about the game is having to do 5 at a time.
